column1: swing. Straight up, but a little too short to cause discomfort. Languid movement away and a watchful defence off the back foot from the batsman outside off
some shape away again. Back of a length and dead-batted into the pitch with a closed face
nice line. Just short of a length with some shape away. Brathwaite comfortable again in getting behind and defending this
length ball on middle stump. Skids straight through and he stabs it into the leg side with soft hands
off the mark. Brathwaite as watchful as ever. Allows this straight length ball to come on and hurriedly jabs it wide of mid-on, who is quite close in
good length and swing into the batsman, who has his front leg out of the way to tap this into the leg side
big inswinger from outside off. Brathwaite hangs deep in the crease and turns it to fine leg with one land
133.6kph, swing away from the left hander, who watches it nicely, gets nicely behind the line and drops it into the covers region with soft hands
batsman aware of the shape this time. Has already shuffled back and across as this swings into his pads and he dabs it to leg gully
oh well done. Shape into the corridor and Brathwaite watches it very closely to ensure it's causing no harm to his stumps. Leaves it alone
jabs it to leg gully's right. Big inswinger at a length again. He's shuffled a long way again. This strategy might work as long as the ball is new, it's doing too much to cause an lbw danger for now
length on the stumps, tapped away into the off side

what a ball! Followed by an excited appeal from Sri Lanka for caught behind. Lakmal angles it into the corridor. Brathwaite, watchful as always, fails to get far enough forward to get close to this as it jags away off the pitch Ends up getting beaten on the outside edge. Sri Lanka won't review. The sound was the ball brushing the back pad
beaten again. Short of a length outside off, plays inside the line once more and can't get close
behind this one. Probing away in the channel, is Lakmal. Brathwaite gets an angled bat on it this time

got him! Lakmal, you gorgeous fella. Completely shattered Brathwaite's mental resolve. He's been jumping around to tackle Gamage's inswinger and suddenly he has four going away from his batting box outside off. Tentative once more. Jabs at this one, the fullest of all the inswingers so far. There is bounce on it and the outside edge carries comfortably through
short ball. Well down leg side. An easy leave
short of a length on leg stump, some shape down. Tickles the pad on the way to the keeper as he looks to glance this
big swing away. Is he controlling it? Hard to say. Starts outside off at a length and goes a long way away. Left aloe
sliced away but with little control. Full outswinger from Gamage in the corridor. Smith's front foot stride is minuscule. The ball's aerial, but wide enough of point to beat him to his left
beaten. Hangs the bat out with a half-stride that hasn't landed before the ball has. Fizzes past the outside edge
full on off stump, looks to drive down the ground. That shy forward stride lets him down again. It's an inside edge into the leg side
jumps past the outside edge. Not a lot of aerial movement this time. Slants across the corridor and flies past the outside edge
full outswinger starting too wide to make him play. Gratefully left alone
short of a length and swinging in. Defended off the back foot
can't get bat on it as it swings in and traps him with his front foot plonked across his body. It's hitting him in front of leg though, that will be not out. A leg bye through square leg
in the air but well short of point. That appears to have stuck in the pitch. Back of a length and just outside off. Leaps off the ground and stabs with hard hands
clipped past square leg. In control of the flick. Turns his bat at just the right moment to deflect this inswinger for two
oh well bowled. Big inswinger at off stump and he defends it very very late
inside edge onto pad. Powell shuffles to try and nudge it fine with the angle. It skids through too quickly

shot. Sweetly timed punch from Powell. In a bit of tangle with his front leg locked as it lands across off stump. But there is enough swing way for some room to be on offer and the ball is full enough for a proper drive past his partner
short of a length and swung away outside off. Left alone
good length and just outside off. Leaves it alone. Some bounce there
good length, too wide to make him play. There is bounce. They are not troubling the batsmen with it!
once more, too wide. Length, swinging away, wide outside off. Puts in a nice front foot stride as he watches it go
length on the stumps. Gets the bat down late, gets it to fine leg off the thick inside edge
short of a length inswinger at off stump. Defended off the back foot
short of a length on the pads, stands tall and whips it behind square. Nicely timed. That length is giving them a lot of time. Good shot.
wide of the crease and a big inswinger in at the corridor. Offers a closed face and squirts this wide of mid-on. Herath performs the athletics there

now we're talking. Steep lift off the surface from Lakmal. Into the corridor from back of a length. Making him play because of the angle. His bat is inside the line though and that's beaten the outside edge

direct hit. Chandimal from cover has sprinted across to his right and broken down the stumps at the striker's end. It was another inswinger, dabbed with soft hands into the off side. Smith does not ground his bat. Plonks it in lazily and just makes it. That would have been a disgusting way to go on your Test comeback. Some would say deserved. But he has survived. Nice work from Sri Lanka's captain.
short of a length and cramping him at off stump. Keeps it out after getting off his toes. Lakmal's front leg was a long way in front of the crease
short all shaping into the corridor. Loses balance as he taps away from the body and gets this to backward point
outswinger dug in at a length, wide outside off, left alone

is there an edge? No. Just past the outside edge. Nicely worked by Gamage. Floats this one up. It's still wide enough to be left but the trajectory draws Powell into trying a drive through the covers. Front foot non-existent and he's almost falling over by the end
length ball outside off, left alone
short of a length, swinging away outside off, left alone
looks to take leg stump but this yorker doesn't swing as much as all the balls prior. Goes straight through, snaps the heels outside leg and deflects past the keeper
dropped short outside off, looks to punch off the back foot and gets it to extra cover off the toe end
good length, swinging down leg side. Can't get bat on the flick
short ball, wide outside off. Slashes at it and gets a thick outside edge down to the third man boundary. Just your everyday left-hander
length ball swung in at middle stump, defended into the leg side
beaten. That steep lift off the surface once more. Angles in and he's looking to defend the inswinger when this jumps past the outside edge
good length on the stumps, tapped to midwicket on the up
short of a length on off stump. Nudged into the off side with soft hands for a well stolen single
steps out and regrets it straight away. It's short of a length and about to run past him outside off. He's forced to block with his body
short of a length at off stump, punched to extra cover off the back foot
arm ball. Skidding through at a length on off stump. Defended off the back foot
steps out and dead-bats down the track. Drifts this in, slower than before on a length at middle stump.
whack. Playing with his length and cashes in on the short one. Skidding outside off and he rocks back to spank it in front of point
short of a length outside off, pushes to backward point from the crease
raps him on the pad but that appears to be both climbing over and swinging away from leg stump. He's on the back foot trying to glance this
inside edge past the stumps. On the back foot to try and force this through cover, but this nips back in late
length ball pushed way too wide. Left alone
short of a length just outside off, defended off the back foot
full and very wide outside off, left alone
good length just outside off, dead-batted into the off side
short of a length on off stump, tapped to cover off the back foot

ah there it is. The first overexcited appeal from Dickwella of the tour. Length ball, steps out and cops it on the front pad well outside off. Dickwella the only man hitting high decibels in the whole continent
short of a length, stabbed to midwicket off the back foot
short ball outside off, chops it behind square on the off side with the open face

Smith's gone! Survived a close run out call earlier, won't do so this time. And once again, you've got to say, that's a lazy effort from him. But was it a good call in the first place? Powell nudged this to midwicket's left who sprinted and fired in a rocket throw right next to the stumps. Smith's stretch to get in lacks any thrust. he's short by an inch
lunges forward and jabs this away, rolls off a thick inside edge past short leg. Shouts of 'aaaaaiyooooo' from Dickwella
leaves alone a length ball slanted across
beauty! Squared up by the length, beaten by the zip. Length ball angling away, he went back and across to defend but saw this whizz past.
shot of the morning! Half-volley on the stumps and he presents the full face to lace this back past the bowler. Beautiful
shortens his length, gets this to zip back in from middle, Powell's feet in the air as he awkwardly defends. Taken by surprise by the pace on this delivery
full and angling away, searching for the late inswing but there is none here, left alone

hit on the box, ouch! This hits length on middle and jags back in as Powell is hit right where it hurts as he played outside the line. He's down for the count. Nothing, absolutely nothing, the physio can do.
gets this to nip back in from way outside off, left alone
gets this to move away off the seam, but this is starting from around the sixth stump. Hope is happy to leave
hops back and across as he defends this length ball outside off. Little late on the stroke
imperious! Picks the length early, swivels back and pulls him in front of square. Brings up 1000 Test runs with that
full and outside off, left alone
full, looks to have him driving, but Hope leaves alone
starts off with a wayward delivery down leg, Dickwella with a superman effort, threw himself to his right to stop one-handed
beaten for pace on this length ball as it thuds into the pad and deflects into the leg side
zippy length ball angling in from wide of the crease, defended with soft hands
squirts this length ball to point. Hopped back and was on the move as he defended that. Working up good pace already
yorker length on leg stump, late on the stroke, somehow managed to keep it out. Dug back to the bowler.
gets on top of the bounce and tucks this short ball on middle and leg to fine leg. The 50 is up for the West Indies
late swing back in, Hope falls over and ends up yorking himself. Well taken by the keeper as ball deflects off the pad.
length ball that hits the deck and straightens from outside off, watched through as he plays inside the line
gets on top of the bounce and punches this short of length delivery into the off side
punched back again, this kept a touch low.
slapped away but can't beat the diving cover fielder. Lucky to get away with that short deivery.
thick edge but he was playing it with soft hands, on the bounce to gully
pacy bouncer, but way over Powell's head, keeper leaps to stop that
squared up by the length ball that moves away a hint, safely negotiated though as he played with soft hands.
jabs this length ball on middle and leg to the off side. Played it with an angled bat face.
works this off his hip, but lost his footing in doing so. Rolls to deep square leg. Could've so easily fallen onto the stumps
plays inside the line as he hears this zippy length ball thud into the keeper's gloves
hops back and defends this incoming length ball towards cover.
goes back to defend this indrifter with soft hands
steps out but Herath slows it down nicely, the ball spins back in to hit the pad.
gets a good stride in and smothers that
rocks back and hammers this away through to the extra cover boundary. Herath went short, got punished.
skids through after pitching, Powell played inside the line as this beat the edge.
beauty! Draws him forward, gets this to dip on him and beat the forward prod.
short and pulled away! Fetched it from outside off, hit in front of square. Lovely
short of length that nips away from outside off, left alone
defends this incoming length ball with soft hands
beaten on the drive! Nowhere near this, beaten for pace. The stroke was brought about perhaps because he'd been getting plenty of short stuff.
gift and gleefully accepted! Full toss outside off, driven through cover point
angles back in but way down leg, keeper collects.
steps out but nowhere near the pitch, looks to flick but gets a thick inside edge that uppishly flies past short leg
lunges forward and defends this flighted delivery with soft hands
flatter and fuller on the stumps from wide of the crease, defended from the crease
flatter in trajectory, just lands this outside off, defended
drops a touch short from wide of the crease, he makes room and crunches this into the gap at deep cover
short and spinning back in, goes back into the crease and whips this towards deep square leg
right back into the crease as he defends this length ball to point
slants one in from wide of the crease, defended back
overpitched and he laces this through extra cover. All class. Deserved to be hit, and he apologetically eased it away and in style
edged, past the diving gully fielder
overpitched on the pads, overbalanced and misses the flick, deflects off the pad to square leg
gets on top of the bounce and flays this short of length delivery towards sweeper cover, Lakmal runs around to his right to put out a tumbling stop, saved two runs
goes back and across as he defends this tossed up delivery on length
lunges forward and smothers this flighted delivery
flatter one on middle, worked to midwicket
rocks back to cut, not all that short, manages to get this away to deep point
not to the pitch, shaped to drive, mistimed to mid-off. Deceived in flight
goes back into the crease and whips this short ball to the midwicket boundary. Picked the length early and brought his wrists into picture, delightful execution.

done in for pace! Kumara, you beauty. This is full, furiously fast and goes through his defences as he looked to flick. This swung in late to draw a thin inside edge to flatten the leg stump. Powell has done all the hard work and then thrown it away.
starts off with a rip roaring bouncer, ducks under it
full toss and punched away past mid-on. Couldn't have asked for a friendlier delivery to get off the mark
too full on the pads, balance perfect as he flicks this into the gap at deep midwicket
gets on top of the bounce and defends this short of length delivery with soft hands
not for the first time he's played this pull today, not for the first time has the timing been magnificent. Short outside off, he gets into position quickly and pulls handsomely in front of square.
driven straight to cover point
drifts in a tossed up delivery from around the stumps, defended back
draws him forward, induces the edge too, but rolls all along the ground to short third man, shaped to drive, checked his stroke
too full and flat outside off, opens up his broad shoulders and belts this through extra cover.
goes back into the crease and defends this tossed up delivery on length
punches this to mid-on
hustled for pace as he looks to defend, the ball deflects off the thigh pad to fine leg
stands tall and punches this length ball to cover
goes back and across as he defends with soft hands
goes full from wide of the crease, defended with minimal footwork. Could land him in trouble.
far too wide outside off, perhaps slipped out. Was he looking to bowl the effort ball? Keeper took it in front of first slip.
uppish, but straight to cover
plays inside to watch this length ball zip past to the keeper. That's lunch on day one
full and very wide. Left alone
full and just outside off, driven on the up to mid-off
short of a length just outside off, defended off the back foot

chases and he's gone! By far the most harmless delivery after lunch. Short and wide outside off. Hurries through a square drive off the back foot and gets a thick outside edge. But there might be hope for him. Gamage appears to have overstepped...yes! No-ball.
length ball wide outside off, left alone
short of a length outside off, punched to mid-off off the back foot
shot! What he was going for during the no-ball dismissal. This one is marginally shorter than that. A fraction more width too. He hammers it through cover point after climbing on top of this
short of a length outside off, left alone
good length and in at off stump. Defended off the back foot
short of a length and nipping away outside off. Left alone again
length outside off, allows it to go through. No movement in the air anymore
some shape there. Even in the air. Scratch what I said last ball. This bends away, but too far away from him to force a shot
short of a length outside off, batsman denies service
floated in full at middle stump, squeezed out to mid-on off the front foot
another floater. Would have been clubbed through cover on the full if it was anywhere near the batsman. In the end, it's too far wide outside off to make him play
good length on off stump, defended off the back foot

given lbw, reviewed straightaway. This length ball keeps low as it skids back in at the batsman. He's off his feet as he's hitting it. I suspect he's struck outside the line of off...yes he has been. Also, there's a big inside edge. No wonder that was an instant review. The decision will be overturned. Kettleborough the umpire. That's the first sign of a ball not rising as much as expected. It's generally been steep bounce so far
ooooohhh tempting. Floaty half-volley just outside off. Tries to draw him in but he resists the temptation and lets it go
another tempter. Short and very wide. Won't take it on with the cut
oh well bowled. Classic Lakmal. Belts it in back of a length just outside off and gets it to jag away despite the angle from his wide-of-the-crease release. Beats the outside edge comfortably
length ball angled in and straigthening at an off stump line. Defends into the covers with soft hands
length ball just outside off. This time the angle in is non-existent. Chase hangs his bat out and gets an inside edge onto pad

this is top quality cricket. Lakmal zooms one into the corridor with all the usual ingredients - angle in, movement away, decent pace. But this one looks like it's landed on the seam and taken off. Chase has been defending those so far but makes the right decision to let this go. Superb viewing.
the indipper but no exaggerated movement on that. Chase defends with slight gap between bat and body outside off
outswinger. Draws him onto the front foot before he decides to leave it
short of a length and rising outside off, left alone
drives inside the line and is beaten. Well bowled. Inswinger in the air, zips away off the pitch. Hope driving a long way outside off
shot, but can't beat the bowler's outstretched arm. Inswinger goes on with the angle this time to meet a crisp straight drive
sweet. But that extra cover guy ruins everything. Hope beautifully leaning into this cover drive against an overpitched ball outside off. A dive to the right means this is a single only
full ball on the pads. Clipped to square leg
oh yes. This is gorgeous. Arguably West Indies' best batsman, keeping the runs flowing amid some disciplined bowling. Leans into a full one and caresses it between extra cover and mid-off
length ball just outside off, tapped into the covers from the crease
beaten. Length ball angled in to the off stump, climbing past the outside edge. How do you play this guy out today?
outside edge dribbles wide of gully. Length ball angled in and straightening. Looks to drive on the up with no front foot movement
length ball in the corridor, defended off the back foot
length ball wide outside off, left alone
length ball outside off, left alone
full ball swinging away late outside off, respectfully tapped into the covers
length ball down leg side, left alone
inswinger, full and headed for middle stump until hope gets the inside half of his bat on it. Very close to the pad
short of a length just outside off, punched to extra cover from the crease
full on leg stump, allows it to come on. The front foot plant much less prominent this time so he can play it right under his eyes, very late. Gets it wide of mid-on
good length just outside off. Defended on the front foot
full ball outside off, driven on the up to point
short of a length just outside off, left alone
length ball slanted in at middle stump. Defended on the front foot
short of a length just outside off, tapped to cover off the back foot
full and some shape away. Very wide outside off. Left alone
full and wide outswinger. Chases after it and manages to get it off the blade. Not a convincing shot. Reaching out, half a stride. But he slices it past point
good length just outside off, swinging away. Left alone
tossed right up outside off, dead-batted into the pitch
short of a length outside off, punched to extra cover off the back foot
tossed up at off stump, driven to extra cover
arm ball. Into the pads, blocked on the front foot
tossed up on middle stump, pushed back to the bowler off the inside halffu
full on leg stump, clipped through midwicket
inswinging yorker. He likes that ball. This one headed for off stump. Leans in and taps into the leg side
short of a length and slanting into the corridor. Gets the bat inside the line and allows this to pass
late swing away but it's full enough for Chase to stab at it. Gets down on his back knee, slices it to the third man boundary
short of a length outside off, left alone
short of a length on middle stump, pushed through square leg
full outside off, check-drive to mid-off
full and in at middle stump. Defended into the leg side off the inside half
floated up at off stump, driven firmly to mid-off
length ball on leg stump, gets on the back foot and whips it through midwicket. That's fifty between them
short of a length on middle stump, gets on the back foot and taps to mid-off
arm ball, cramps him as he shapes to punch off the back foot through midwicket. Thick inside edge runs fine
tossed up wide outside off, driven firmly to extra cover
short of a length wide outside off, left alone
yorker outside off. Jams it into the point region
short of a length just outside off, defended off the back foot
yes. Once in a while, this guy lands one at 140kph that straightens away from a length. Chase looking to drive on the up can't get close to getting bat on it
short of a length on leg stump, flicked to deep square
good length wide outside off, left alone
tossed up outside off, he stretches forward and blocks
goes back into the crease and stabs this away
lunges forward and works this with the spin back to the bowler
sees the flight, look to whip this over midwicket but doesn't get the elevation, mistimes to the fielder there
gets to the pitch of the ball and turns this to short midwicket
goes back when he should've been well forward, somehow manages to work this to square leg.

has he gloved this? Yes, he has. Aggression from Kumara and he's been rewarded. Banged this in short into the ribcage, Hope is hustled for pace and so is pushed back as he tries to nudge this away, but it kisses the glove on its way to keeper Dickwella, who grabs this on the second attempt.
hops across and works this gently towards a limbering Lakmal, should've been two
floated full outside off, there for the drive, but he lets it go
touch fuller, just outside off again, Chase has a good look at this as he lets it go
gift of a full toss, just bunted to deep point
full on off, he hops across and defends.
tossed up on middle and leg, defended with soft hands
too much flight and gets the treatment. Chase is right to the pitch as he belts this through cover
once again, tosses it up nicely, Chase eases this wide of cover for a quick single
goes back and across as he whips this shortish delivery to backward square leg
goes back into the crease and turns this indrifter to short leg
nice flight, lands this just a touch outside off, he lunges forward and blocks.
angles in a short of length delivery that keeps a touch low, defended back
that's whacked his thumb as he looks to evade a short ball. Superb from Kumara, banged into the body. Chase looks to take his bottom hand off as he looks to get on top, boom! That's going to hurt
right into the blockhole on off, squeezed out
angled down leg, left alone. Keeper collects
short of length on off, he's right on top of the bounce as he defends.
shows the full face of the bat as he defends this short ball
gets a good stride in and defends
fuller and flatter on off, defended back
drifts in and deflects off the thigh pad to short fine as he looks to work this behind square
waits for this to spin back in as he defends
worked with the spin wide of midwicket
lunges forward and defends with soft hands.
driven with the spin to mid-off
nice flight, lands this on middle, defended back.
drilled down to mid-on, quick single taken
drifting down leg, he looks to tickle fine but misses. Good take by Dickwella
reaches out and drives this tossed up delivery to extra cover
flatter and fuller on off, kept out
tossed up on middle, he eases this back to the bowler
slows this down, holds his length back just a bit, Chase uses his reach and lunge to defend
eased with the spin to long-on
too full on middle and leg, once again works this down to long-on
fired full on off, squeezed towards cover point
spins back into middle and leg, worked towards short fine
tossed up on the stumps from around the wicket, defended back
short and sliding into middle and leg, tucked to deep backward square leg

sharp grab at slip! Rangana strikes and Chase has paid the price for error in judgment. This was an armball that skidded through after pitching, Chase in two minds, went for a lazy waft but this was too close to him, ended up getting a thick edge and Mathews was super sharp as he plucked that.
nice flight, Holder defends
drifts in a full ball from around the stumps, squeezed out
works this tossed up delivery to mid-on
length on off stump, defended back
is besides the line of this length ball as he defends to the off side
punched but can't pick the gap, straight to cover
squared up by the length but he defends
crunching drive but straight to cover again, scoring opportunity missed.
right back and across as he defends this incoming length delivery
full on off from around the stumps, bunted gently
turns this indrifter to the leg side with soft hands
nice flight, lands this outside off, driven firmly, but silly point cops a blow
cramped for room, goes through with the cut anyway, straight to backward point
right to the pitch as he eases this to mid-off
right to the pitch of the ball as he defends with soft hands towards cover
full on off from wide of the crease, minimal feet movement as Dowrich defends.
nips back in from length, tucked to square leg. Late inward movement for Gamage
back of length delivery nipping away from outside off, left alone
lands this a touch ahead of length on off, Dowrich is squared up, right shoulder facing the bowler as he defends that
angles a short of length ball on middle and leg from wide of the crease, defended with soft hands
sways out of the line of this short ball outside off.
round-armish lovely on off, right forward as Holder defends

lunges forward to drive but this one's quite not there, dips on him but he goes through with the stroke. Smashes it off the inside edge onto the pad and the boot, but this may have just bounced into the turf and then lobbed up. Proper proof on replays, so this comes back as not out. The soft signal will stay that way.
too full and sliding into the pads, Holder's balance and poise impeccable as he flicks this with the angle to bisect midwicket and mid-on
purposeful drive into the gap at deep extra cover
arm ball, plays outside, rolls off the inner half to the leg side
has he tickled to the keeper? Not out says Aleem Dar. Too short and sliding into middle and leg, he looked to whip this behind square but played early. Flicked the pad.
short, wide and waiting to be thrashed, he slashes and misses.
excellent short ball on middle and off, Dowrich is hurried into his fend, but he does it well. Got on top of the bounce nicely
full and swinging away late from outside off, left alone.
right in the slot to drive, width there as well but he's happy to leave
besides the line of this length ball as he defends.
gets half a stride in as he defends this to cover. Tea on day one
length ball delivered very wide outside off. Left alone on the front foot
length ball just outside off, defended off the back foot
deftly done, but a dive at fine leg keeps it to two. Length ball on the stumps. He stays tall and tickles it fine. Looks like it's Kumara there, sliding to his right
length ball outside off, cutting away outside off. Left alone
length ball outside off, left alone

this looks plumb. Holder hasn't moved his front foot a lot - he's quite deep as this length ball comes in and strikes him bang in front of middle. It's good on height too, for the bowler. Doesn't look like an edge on it. Holder reluctantly reviews...oh hang on! Replays show a spike as the ball passes the bat...an inside edge! Didn't look like Holder knew about it. Baffling sequence of play. But he survives. The review is retained too, of course.
length outside off, left alone
fiery! Bangs it in outside off, takes it away from the initial angle off the pitch and just misses the outside edge
full one on the pads, a controlled flick to deep square's left
short of a length and in at the stumps. Nudges it wide of mid-on off the back foot
length ball speared in at middle stump. No feet as he taps this off the inside half to mid-on...where Herath, obviously, has faked a misfield to mislead the batsman. Poor Dowrich almost falls for it.
short ball on off stump, gets on his toes to defend. That stopped on him
length ball on middle stump and he offers the full face and uses his reach to get this past the non-striker
late awayswing beats Holder. Front foot not moving towards the ball as he looks to drill it through cover
short of a length outside off, defended with soft hands towards gully
full outside off, blocked on the front foot
yikes! A glitch. Like your first ball in a new video game. Whacked into the pitch at leg stump and then massive movement down leg side. Dickwella won't even try to stop it
well bowled. Gets this to climb in off the seam, but Holder manages to nudge it through square leg
overpitched ball on the stumps, flicked straight to mid-on
boom! And then a single. Holder happy with the short one. Gets under it quickly and slaps in front of square, but deep square is a bit straight out there
short of a length just outside off, defended off the back foot

falls just short of mid-on who takes a second to assess which way to move before sprinting in. Woeful shot from Dowrich. No position to play the pull - he struggles with this shot quite a bit - and his head is looking away. Ends up slicing off the high part of the bat
148kph, but that one is going down leg and he will not try and get close to it. Might have been the fastest ball of the day
short of a length ball on off stump, defended off the back foot
length ball just outside off. Uses the shape away to push this through point off the outside half
short of a length ball pushed down leg side, left alone
clips the pad and it's past Dickwella. Flat-footed, the keeper. Doesn't get near this one. In his defence, it's a dreadful ball, shaping away from leg stump
length ball outside off, defended to point off the front foot
length ball wide outside off, left alone
buh-bye. Short ball on the pads - he swivels, he watches it, he swats it away to long leg
oh well done. This might be Kumara's best day in Test cricket. Consistently hitting a good length in the corridor. Gets another one to go past the edge
bounce. Short ball, moving away menacingly past the outside edge
too short. Gets it over Holder's head...well over...
length ball down leg side, can't get bat on the glance
loose. Holder hanging the bat out again. Beaten on the drive on the up
short ball jagging away outside off. Left alone
another one too short for Holder to play a shot. This one outside off
full on leg stump, defended down the pitch
tossed up at off stump, defended on the front foot
tossed up on off stump, tapped to mid-off on the front foot
straighter one, short of a length outside off. Left alone
full ball on leg stump, flicked straight to midwicket
short of a length outside off, chopped to point's right
he goes for the yorker. Holder has a big reach, so he decides to meet it on the full instead. Then it's a simple tap through the vast covers region
short ball on the hips, whipped to deep square
short of a length on leg stump, tapped to midwicket
short ball just outside off, climbs on top of it to defend
short ball outside off, left alone
short of a length outside off, defended off the back foot
full ball on leg stump, pings off the pad as he looks to block
good length on off, pushed to cover on the front foot
length on middle stump, pushed to long-on
length on the stumps, defended on the front foot
full on off stump, driven on the bounce to extra cover
length on off, blocked on the front foot
length ball on middle stump, defended off the inside half
length ball turning in at off stump, defended off the back foot
good length on middle stump, front foot push to mid-on
short of a length outside off, tapped to mid-off
length outside off, punched to mid-off

nearly picks out long-on! Looks like a neat pick-up from Holder, but that's before I see the fielder it back. Whips it off the front foot with the turn and that lands in front of the diving Roshen Silva. He can only parry it into the boundary
length on leg stump, flicked into the leg side
length on leg, blocked on the front foot
floated up full outside off. Reaches out on the front foot and drills it firmly between cover and short extra. Nicely done
tossed up at leg stump, driven straight to mid-on
short of a length outside off, punched to mid-off off the back foot
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
length ball lands and skids straight through. He's looking to defend on the back foot and is beaten on the outside edge
tossed up at leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
short ball outside off, opens his stance and chops to deep point
length on middle stump, pushed back down the pitch
length on middle stump, flicked uppishly to midwicket
short of a length outside off, punched to deep point's right
length ball on middle stump, defended on the front foot
tossed up at off stump, dug out to mid-off on the front foot
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot

oh well done Holder! Stunning wristwork. It's a loopy length ball outside off. He's reaching out and is beaten in flight, but he adjusts perfectly to find the gap between backward point and cover point
length on off stump, defended off the back foot
tossed up on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length ball on leg stump, defended with soft hands
length outside off, pushed past slip off the outside half
full outside off, defended into the covers off the front foot
full on leg stump, flicked to deep backward square. That's 200 and they're keeping them alive
short of a length outside off, tapped to deep point
full on leg stump, flicked to short midwicket
length on middle stump, pushed into the leg side off the inside half
length ball on off stump, defended down the pitch
arm ball at off stump, defended from the crease
full on off stump, driven to extra cover
length on leg stump, defended into the leg side
good length outside off, pushed to point on the front foot
full on leg stump, driven to long-on

dropped! Mathews puts down a straightforward chance at first slip. Lapse of concentration from the veteran. Late to react to this to his right. It's just under knee height. The natural variation getting Dowrich as he looks to block on the front foot
loud shout as he goes on the back foot to try and pull. Struck on the thigh as he looks to do this
length on the stumps, nudged to fine leg off the back foot
full on off stump, driven to mid-off
length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket
lifts it over square leg. Too simple for Dowrich. It's a short ball into his legs. He's in position early and does well to get the ball right off the face of the bat to find the fence
well done at point. Short and wide ball is clobbered with a square cut. The fielder leaps to his left to stop
length ball outside off, left alone
length ball outside off, defended on the front foot
short ball on middle stump, swivels and pulls to deep square
length ball angled in at off stump. Defended on the front foot
short of a length outside off, quickly shuffles to make room and pummel this through extra cover. Slowly getting into his element, this man.
length on middle stump, flicked to midwicket with the turn
good length on middle stump, blocked on the front foot
length ball on middle stump, flicked to deep square off the back foot
good length on middle stump, flicked to midwicket
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
width outside off, cut away to deep cover. Oversteps in his quest for pace, maybe?
yorker-length outside off, squeezed back
back of length that nips away a wee bit from outside off, left alone
good stride forward as he bunts this into the cover region for a quick single
wanted to drive, then leave but somehow managed to get the bottom edge as he tried to evade it, rolls to slip
solidly defended back to the bowler
short of length on off, he gets on top of the bounce and defends back
flatter one on middle and leg, worked behind square for an easy single
fired full on the pads, worked wide of square leg
drifts in a shortish ball on middle and leg, whipped past midwicket
lazy effort from Dilruwan as he moved to his left to stop, they steal a single even though mid-on wasn't far from the ball and was coming in quickly
lunges forward and turns this to short mid-on
sharp turn, beats his stab to hit him on the pad, but the impact was outside off.
full on off, hint of movement away, defended back solidly
no mid-off, firm push and mid-on comes across to stop that drive
full and shaping away from off, plants forward and outside the line of the stumps as he blocks
back of length outside off, punched to cover
length outside off, defended back with soft hands
shows the full face of the bat to defend this overpitched ball to the bowler. Now that's a scoring opportunity missed.
worked with the spin to midwicket
ends up slicing this drive into the gap at backward point, down towards the boundary rider
fired full and flat on off, defended
stabs this away with the bat well in front of the pad
full on middle and off, turned to the leg side
leading edge but safe, rolls wide of the bowler, to mid-off.
loose ball first up, gleefully accepted. Width outside off, Dowrich cracked this to the point boundary
pulled imperiously, but straight to deep square leg

oh, dear. Another regulation catch goes down at slip! This is a healthy edge to second slip, straight in and straight out. Roshen Silva the man there. Coming to the stroke, this was a nothing waft away from the body when he could've well left alone, lucky that he can now laugh about it with his mate at the other end. Juggled two attempts before putting it down
full but way outside off, left alone but Roshen can't stop that at slip as keeper deflects it to him
forgettable shot, a slash at that but missed
lovely square drive to the boundary rider
worked with the spin to midwicket
pushed back by the pace and length, turned to square leg
fired full on off, kept out
slaps this pull down to long-on
flatter one that spins back in from outside off, defended from the crease
tucked behind square on the legside as they jog the single
gets on top of the bounce and cuts this down to deep point

this is way too full outside off, Holder looks to drive but in doing so the bat hits the turf at the same time the ball goes past, but ultraedge confirms there was a thin outside edge too, so Holder has to walk back. He really wouldn't have known because of the bat hitting the ground at the same time, but he can introspect later. That's another start wasted and Sri Lanka have a breakthrough against the run of play
full but swinging down leg, keeper can't stop it cleanly despite a dive. But there's no damage done
inside edge onto the pad as this lobs up, no forward short leg though.
full and angling away, left alone
full and angling away again, squeezed to cover
flatter one on middle and leg, defended to the leg side
lunges forward and blocks
turn and bounce from the rough patches on middle, keeper taken by surprise too
plants outside the line of the stumps as he defends
worked with the spin towards deep mdiwicket
tossed up outside off, he gets forward and defends back
mistimes a pull that he fetches from outside off, good work at mid-on
right into the blockhole, kept out
ducks under this short ball on middle, avoided easily
back of length outside off, punched to cover
sliding down leg. clipped away towards deep square leg
looks to evade this bouncer but it's too quick for him, somehow manages to get behind the line and fend
flatter one on middle and leg, turned to deep midwicket
fired full on the stumps, blocked
lunges forward and keeps out this full ball drifting in
punches this shortish delivery to cover
quicker one on the body at length from around the stumps, defended bsck
almost through him. Late to get his bat down, but no damage done, this squirts away to backward point
full on off, defended with soft hands.
stands tall and punches this short of length delivery wide of mid-off
slower and fuller delivery outside off, looked to drive but lets it go at the last moment
sways out of the way of this short ball on middle and leg, dropped his wrists and watched it go. Good technique
right into the blockhole, squeezed out
beauty that angles in and leaves him late. Not far from the edge as he had a poke
lunges forward and dabs with soft hands
works this full delivery with the angle to mid-on
flatter one on middle and leg from around the stumps, worked to midwicket
stretches forward and smothers this full delivery
full outside off, hint of turn away, left alone
gets a good stride in and defends back
hint of late movement back in, the length is a touch full, defended from the crease
short but angling down leg, misses the tickle
searches for late swing by bowling this full, there's none here, left alone
length ball that jags back in from off stump, defended carefully by Bishoo
gets on top of the bounce and steers this back of length delivery to point
I have no idea how he managed to keep out that yorker. Curved in late, was headed to hit middle of middle until the bat somehow plonked itself in front
short and swinging in, pulled away towards deep midwicket
too full but way outside off, left alone
curves away late but since this is a length ball, Bishoo has just a wee bit more time to leave
gets right to the pitch of the ball as he defends back
right back and across as he carefully allows the ball to slide in to the bat
full and swinging away from outside off, left alone
hops across and defends with soft hands
hits length and takes off, Dowrich is on top of the bounce as he defends. Was in control despite uneven bounce this time
jabs this full delivery from the crease
flicks this length ball on middle and leg to fine leg
short of length angling away, Bishoo sways out of the way
full but sliding down leg, beats the pad, through to the keeper
defends this length delivery from the crease
too short but angling down leg, tickled to fine leg
shapes to punch but then decides to leave this alone right at the last moment as it swings away late
there for the drive, too much width but no feet from Bishoo, beaten.
overpitched outside off, begging to be driven, Bishoo lets it go.
late swing away from outside off, left alone and that's stumps.
full outswinger outside off, Dowrich falls into it and manages to stab it past mid-off
beaten. Lakmal doing his stuff. Bends it away from a middle-and-off line to beat his back foot defence
shot! And that's fifty. Dowrich with one of his go-to shots - the late short-arm jab over square leg. Lakmal drops it marginally short. It's still swinging away, but this is right off the middle
short of a length outside off, left alone
full ball outside off, defended solidly on the front foot
leading edge as he looks to play the glance. Natural shape away again, finds the outside of the bat and the ball dribbles into the covers
length on leg stump, flicked through square leg off the back foot. Off to a blazing start today, Bishoo!
length ball into the pads, whipped to fine leg
short of a length from around the wicket. Chases it with a square drive and gets an under-edge into the pitch
short and very wide. Looks to play the upper cut, beaten
short one outside off, left alone
short and too wide to make him play. Left alone

big appeal for caught behind. Length ball straightens in the corridor and there's a noise as it goes through to the keeper. Sri Lanka want to review this not out decision, but they're timed out. Lucky for them, that was not out. Brushed the back pad
length on leg stump, reaches out and stabs to midwicket on the up
length ball on the pads. Looks to flick but he can't get bat on it. Lands in front of the diving Dickwella
length ball wide outside off, left alone
bottom edge jams into the pitch and goes through to first slip on the bounce. Dowrich late in bringing the bat down on this outswinger as he looks to defend on the front foot
full outswinger outside off, left alone
short ball banged into the corridor. Looks to defend on the back foot and gets an inside edge onto pad
squared up a little, Bishoo. This is a new angle, and the pace clearly has him nervous. Jabs at one wide outside off and gets it to point off the outside half
explodes from a length and squares him up again. This time the bounce is too steep for him to get close to connecting on it. Once again, just hanging the bat out

outside edge through the cordon. Well, the edge was coming. To his credit, this time he's playing close to the body with soft hands. Straightens after angling in and it's gone between third slip and gully.
yorker on middle stump. Digs it out to square leg
nice. Outswinger from around the wicket. Bishoo back at it, fending at the ball. This one he should be playing on the front foot as it shapes away in the corridor and past the bat
length ball wide outside off, left alone
good length and shaping away outside off, left alone
length ball swinging away outside off, left alone
short of a length just outside off. Left alone
length ball outside off, left alone. Lakmal looks up in despair. Another one he believes was too easy for the batsman to leave
and again. Outswinger too wide outside off to make him play
145kph yorker first up. Right up at middle stump, but defended easily into the off side
fizzes over off stump after beating the outside edge. Bishoo hopping into the leg side and defending from inside the line against this length ball going across him
short ball slanted across off stump, left alone
short ball at the ribs. On the back foot and nervously poked into the off side
beaten again. Hangs back against a length ball outside off which means he won't get close to edging this. He'll tell you it's intentional...
short ball outside off, scrambles deep in the crease and blocks
short ball outside off, inside edge into the pitch as he looks to chop it through the covers
beats the inside edge. This is smartly done. Same line and length as his outswingers but this one goes in with the angle. Dowrich has no clue
good length outside off, defended to cover off the front foot
beaten on the pull. Outswinger dropped a tad short. Dowrich quickly at it, but it slides through from under his shot

improvises and tickles it fine. It's a long leg in place now. He won't get there. Lakmal goes for another one that angles in - this one headed for middle and leg. Dowrich stays back in the crease and gets it off the inside part of the bat
length ball just outside off, defended off the back foot
full on leg stump, pushed into the leg side
gingerly prods at this length ball on the stumps. Gamage's natural drift away from the left hander kisses the outside edge and he finds two to backward point's right
length ball down leg side, can't get bat on the flick
length ball wide outside off, left alone
...and for a change he gets one to go the other way. Except it has started on leg and continued to go down. Dickwella will bear the punishment for that on the scorecard for no reason
length ball swinging a long way away. Too wide outside off, left alone
length ball too wide, left alone
short of a length just outside off, defended off the back foot
well bowled. Floats up the outswinger on off stump. Dowrich stuck to the crease as he defends and the weight transfer happens very late. This is why extra cover is close in.
well bowled Lakmal. Narrowly misses off stump. Dowrich expecting an outswinger in the corridor, caught off guard as it comes back with the angle

squares him up but he manages to offer soft hands. In many ways, that's the outstanding feature of his batting. When he's not playing the pull, he's always playing it softly. This hoops away from a middle stump line, his body is turned into the leg side as he makes connection
length ball outside off, left alone
yorker length outswinger at middle and off. Opens up and jams it into the covers
pitches on leg stump, and seaming across his body. Flays it off the back foot to cover
full on middle, but swinging down the leg side. The ball stays low too, and the keeper has to put in a dive
full on middle, and angling into his pads. Flicks it off his legs past the midwicket region with ease for the session's first boundary
full outside off, and he gets onto the front foot to play the drive. Hit straight to mid off
full outside off, and driven past the cover region. Work for Herath, who scampers across the ground to clean up. They'll take two
full on leg, and Bishoo clips it off his toes to the man at fine leg. They jog across for the single
back of a length on off, but angling down the leg side. Cramps the batsman up slightly, but he still manages to stay away from the ball
fuller outside off, and he goes for the drive. Takes the outside edge and flies past second slip. Races away for a boundary. If only there was a third slip...
bangs it in short, but there's really no bounce. Pitches on off, and angles down the leg side. The keeper collects on the bounce
length ball outside off, and Dowrich tries to defend off the back foot. Played down the wrong line, and the ball goes just past his outside edge. That'll keep Sri Lanka interested
full outside off, and Dowrich is happy to shoulder his arms. Safely sees the over out
full on off, and defended off the front foot
length ball outside off. Spinning slightly away, and Bishoo fends it with soft hands. Played to first slip
full, and outside off again. Bishoo keeps his hands soft, and blocks towards the offside
extra flight this time, and it lands on middle stump. Almost a yorker, and Bishoo digs it back to the bowler
full on off, and defended off the front foot to the man at cover point. Carefully played
gives it a rip, and it lands outside off. Bishoo takes a big stride forward and blocks it to cover point. Maiden

big appeal for lbw! But not given. It was a length ball outside off that jagged in sharply. The batsman was trapped in front of his crease, and the ball hit his back leg. Sri Lanka are reviewing. Hits him above the knee roll, and impact's umpire's call, and it's umpire's call on wickets as well. The batsman survives, but Sri Lanka retain the review.
length ball on off, and going down the leg side. Dowrich shuffles towards the off side, but doesn't get contact off his bat
awry! Back of a length on middle, and going way down the leg side. The keeper does well to collect it
full, and just outside off. Forces Dowrich to play at it, and he drives it to the fielder at cover
full on off, and that's been comfortably clipped off his pads to deep backward square leg. Enough time to jog back for the second run
back of a length outside off, but angling into his body. Tries to work it towards square leg, but the ball hits his pads instead. They walk across for the run anyway
full on middle stump, and spinning into his body. Too much turn, infact. Goes down the leg side
full outside off, and this time he drives it down the ground. Straight to mid off
arm ball outside off, and the ball goes straight through. Dowrich is happy to let it go
tossed up outside off, and Dowrich blocks off the front foot
full just outside off, and he brings his front foot forward to block once again
Dowrich is clueless! Full outside off, and Dowrich tries to defend for the turn. It doesn's spin, and the ball zips just past his outside edge. Phew
length ball outside off, and Bishoo blocks it off the back foot. Off the bat's middle
back of a length outside off, and Bishoo backs away to make some room. Taps it to cover point and gets off strike
back of a length on off, but angling into his body. Too much angle, in fact. Goes down the leg side
length ball outside off, and that's been stylishly cut away. Plays it front of his body, but well stopped by short cover. Gets his hands to it, and saves three for certain
pitches on leg, and angling across Bishoo's body. He punches it to cover and scampers across for one
back of a length outside off, and he sticks his bat out. Cuts it to gully, and the fielder misfields! Lets it go through, with allows Dowrich to keep strike for the next over. Dilruwan the fielder
full just outside off, and defended with soft hands towards point. A comfortable run
full outside off, and turning away from the left-hander. He defends at it, but the ball takes the outside edge. Goes just past first slip
full outside off, and Bishoo comes forward to meet it on the full. Defended to cover
full on off and going straight through. Angling into his pads, and Bishoo does well to defend it towards the leg side
full just outside off, and defended towards the off side. Once again quick to get onto the front foot
full just outside off, and turning further away. Defended with the bat's angled face to point
length ball on off, and that's been whipped off the back foot to deep backward square. Partnership of 52 now

just over mid off! Full outside off, and Bishoo uses his feet to get to the pitch of the ball. Lifts it over the bowler, and Kumara - at mid off - reacts just a bit slowly. Goes over his outstretched hands
full just outside off, and this time he defends carefully off the front foot
length ball outside off, and he stays on the back foot. Blocked towards the off side
full on middle and leg, and Bishoo muscles this to the man at square leg. The fielder ensures Bishoo can't get off strike
flighted, and lands outside off. Turns sharply into his pads, but Bishoo manages to play it towards the leg side
full outside off, and spinning inwards. Driven to mid on
length ball outside off, and spinning away from him. This time he confidently cuts it past backward point for two more
full just outside off, and he blocks it off the front foot. This should frustrate the SL bowlers
pitches just outside off, and attempts to play the drive. Flays it past cover point instead
full on off, and Dowrich gets to the pitch of the delivery. Defends it back to Perera
so close! Full outside off, and spinning inwards. Bishoo tried to defend, but played it down the wrong line. Goes just past the bat's outside edge to the keeper
full outside off, and blocked off the front foot
length ball outside off, and spinning into Bishoo. He makes some room and then taps it with soft hands towards cover point
length ball on off, and Bishoo stays on the back foot. Taps it towards the off side
wide outside off, and Bishoo backs away before punching it back to Herath
full just on off, and Dowrich comes onto the front foot to see the over out. Defended back to the bowler
full on middle, and Bishoo goes deep into his crease. Flicks it towards deep backward square leg
full on off and he comes forward to defend. Blocked back to Perera
full on off, and turning away from Bishoo. He leans into a drive, and plays it towards cover
flighted, and lands on middle. Bishoo awkwardly defends towards the leg side. The ball didn't turn, and that's why he had to adjust his shot
full on middle and going straight through. Bishoo blocks with ease
extra flight this time, but Bishoo's up for the challenge. Drives it towards the non-striker on this occasion

full on off, and that's been swept hard! Roshen Silva - at short leg - takes a blow. Where's he hurt?! He's grimacing on the floor. Hits his left knee, ouch. A difficult chance, but Dowrich could've been out if Roshen managed to catch it. He's walking out with the help of the physio
full just outside off, and driven straight back to the bowler
length ball on middle, and Dowrich goes onto the back foot. Punches it to mid on this time
full on off, and Dowrich gets inside the line of the ball. Defends it towards the non-striker
full just outside off, and Dowrich takes a big stride forward. Defends towards the off side
length ball outside off, and he goes to the back foot. Fended to mid off
full on off, and turning away from him. Bishoo manages to block it towards cover point though
flighted outside leg stump. Bishoo gets his front foot towards the pitch of the ball, and pushes it towards the bowler
full on leg, and turning across the batsman. Blocked off the front foot once again
full on middle, and defended towards the leg side this time. Always ensuring he plays with soft hands with slip and short leg lurking
length ball on leg stump, and that's been fended off the back foot. Soft hands again
flighted on off, and blocked off the front foot. Plays it to cover point this time
full just outside off, and spinning into his body. Defended
stays low!  Full on middle and going down the leg side. Dowrich tries to flick it square but the ball hits his front pad. Impact outside leg
length ball outside off, and Bishoo is forced to reach at it. Taps it towards point off the back foot
a lot of flight offered, but the ball's too wide outside off. Taps it off the back foot to deep point, and West Indies reach 300!
flighted on middle, and he punches it off the back foot to midwicket. Easily negated by Dowrich
length ball on leg, and turning across the left-hander. He backs away and flays it towards cover point
drops his length a bit more, and the ball generates some extra bounce! Bishoo opens his bat'sn face and cuts towards point
full on off, and Bishoo cuts it with the bat's angled face to deep point
full on middle, and that's been easily driven to long on for a walking single
full on middle and leg, and Bishoo takes a big stride forward. Defended towards mid on
full just outside off, and spinning into the batsman. Driven to mid off this time
full outside off, straightens after pitching. Carefully watches it, Dowrich, before blocking it with soft hands
tossed up outside off, and that's been caressed off the front foot. Straight to cover though
full on off, and blocked off the front foot by Dowrich
full on off again, and this time Dowrich's front-foot defense finds its way to long off
full just outside off, but Bishoo defends it firmly to cover. No turn from Herath this time
full just outside off, blocked off the front foot
full on off, and spinning into his pads. Tapped to mid on
full on middle, and Dowrich gets inside the line of the ball. Drives it to long on, and that's a lot of time for the batsman to take the single
full on middle stump, and angling into his pads. Nudges it off the bat's inside half to square leg. Short leg goes chasing after it, and that allows Bishoo to get off strike
full just outside off, and fended off the front foot to the bowler
full just outside off, and fended with the turn towards the leg side. Smothers it to the vacant region in front of short leg
wild shot from Bishoo! Short on leg, and he tries to pull it towards fine leg. Makes absolutely no contact
back of a length on leg, and angling across the batsman's body. Fended off the back foot towards short cover on this occasion
full on off, and swinging across the batsman. Takes a big stride forward and defends it to cover
length ball on off, and Bishoo simply sticks his bat out with the ball angling across him. Manages to under-cut it past short third man, and Lakmal has to give it a chase
full just on off, and that's been blocked off the back foot. Ensured he shuffled behind the line of the delivery
full outside off, and angling further away. Through to the keeper, and Bishoo's surprised that's not been called a wide
full on off, and fended off the front foot
full outside off, and turning into his pads. Blocked once more
length ball outside off, and that's been whipped off his pads to deep backward square leg. Played too well, so that means it's only a single
full just outside off, and that's been driven back to the bowler
full outside off, but spinning into Bishoo. Big stride forward, and blocked thereafter
full on leg stump, and that's been defended to the bowler once more. Easy peasy
full outside off, but the ball swings in sharply. Aimed at Dowrich's pads, but he manages to turn it towards the leg side
length ball outside off, but once again some inward movement. Stands tall and punches it to mid off
length ball outside off, but doesn't swing in this time. Tapped off the back foot to the vacant point region on this occasion
wayward! Short, but way down the leg side. Forces the keeper to go tumbling to his right
shouts of 'catch it', but lands short of gully. Short ball, and surprises Bishoo this time. He tried to play it towards point, but the ball found the top edge of Bishoo's bat. Lands short though
length ball on middle, and that's been blocked off the back foot. Sees the over out
length ball on off, and turning into Dowrich. Worked off his pads to the sweeper fiewlder on the leg side
full just outside off, and blocked off the front foot to the vacant cover region. The bowler scampers across, so no chance of a single
length ball outside off, and spinning further away. Mistimes his cut to point
full on leg stump, and Bishoo has to adjust his footwork. Awkwardly defended towards mid on
full on off, and Bishoo drives it back to the bowler. Well stopped by Perera
full on off, and he mistimes his drive to mid on. Enough time to take the run
short on leg stump, and he attempts the pull. Top-edges it to the fine-leg boundary
back of a length on leg stump, and this time Bishoo ducks under the line of the ball
full on leg, and this time it's been clipped to the sweeper fielder on the leg side for a run
length ball outside off, and this time Dowrich stays on the back foot. Blocked off the back foot
full outside off, and angling further away. No shot offered from Dowrich, and that sends the keeper tumbling to his right
full on leg stump, and Bishoo attempts to defend it straight. Inside-edged onto his pad, and then goes to the off side
full on leg stump, and defended to mid on off the front foot. Perera asking questions now...
full outside leg, and Bishoo's had enough. Goes for the release shot, and sweeps it to backward square
full outside off, but no spin this time. Dowrich stays on the back foot, pokes his bat at the ball, and then plays the late cut past first slip. More runs
flighted on off, and tapped to mid on off the front foot. Quickly intercepted by the fielder
full just outside off, and he gets to the pitch of the ball. Fends it towards the leg side
short on off, and Bishoo shoulders his arms. The ball goes past his helmet, and then swings wildly towards the leg side. Forces the keeper to dive
length ball on leg stump, and Bishoo flicks it towards the leg side. Not hit with any power
short again! And once again asking questions to Bishoo. Pitches on middle, and the batsman does well to sway his head out of the ball's line
back of a length on leg stump, and Bishoo's cramped for space. Taps it towards square leg though
short on leg stump, and Bishoo shuffles across to the off side. Exposes his leg stump, but the ball goes down the leg side
length ball on leg stump, and angling across Bishoo. Stays on the back foot and blocks it towards mid off. Time for drinks
floaty slider outside off. Leans in and guides it to deep backward point's left off the outside half
length ball on leg stump. Pushes forward and gets it to short leg off the inside edge
length on leg stump, sweeps off the inside edge to short fine
tossed up at leg stump and a leading edge dies on Dilruwan as Bishoo looks to flick
length on off stump, defended off the front foot

mix-up but safe. Tossed up outside leg stump. He looks to whip it but gets a deflection off his front pad that dribbles in front of a flat-footed short fine leg. Bishoo responds late but makes it at the other end
bouncer down leg side. Takes it on with a hook but can't connect
length ball swinging away outside off. Plays it late and gets it to cover's right
length ball at the stumps, taps to deep square's left
top edge lands just inside at the fine leg boundary. Bouncer again, hook shot again. But this one was closer to his shoulder and he managed to get bat on it as a result. Safely.
brutal! Kumara sends the next bouncer up at Bishoo's helmet and he won't even think of a hook this time. Couldn't if he tried. Awkwardly gets out of the way
short of a length but it looks like the last ball is still on Bishoo's mind. Looks to get out of the way and nervously defends
short of a length on leg stump, tapped to short fine off the back foot
length on leg stump, defended into the leg side off the front foot
length ball down leg side, left alone
tossed up at leg stump, driven to long-on
clobbers this but finds deep square. Nice loopy full ball outside leg and he has short leg scared with his sweep
allows this to come on and hit his back leg right in front of the stumps. Dickwella will appeal. That's pitching outside leg
length ball outside off, backs away and fends to extra cover
well played. Bishoo with good improvisation as one climbs steeply at his ribs. His first instinct is still to get on the back foot, but this time he's looked to score. Dabs it fine
bouncer slanted across his back shoulder, left alone
short ball at off stump, comfortably dead-batted off the back foot
...I will leave them anyway, says Bishoo. Bouncer in the corridor, with the angle tilted in at him. Sways out of the line gracefully
short one at off stump, nicely behind this to defend
tossed up at leg stump, flicked to midwicket
length ball down leg side. Looks to sweep but can't connect. Dickwella has heard something as he takes the catch, but he's the only one appealing and it's turned down
length outside leg stump, deflected off the thigh, no shot offered
into the 90s with an under-edged sweep. Length ball outside leg. Gets down and manages to tickle this past leg slip. It's also the 100 for this stand
tossed up at leg stump, flicked to midwicket
short ball down leg side. A loose attempt at a glance. Beaten
inswinger. At a length on middle stump. Solidly blocked on the front foot

beaten on the outside edge. This is why Lakmal's average is 43. By far the best bowler in this team, always troubling the bat, never finding the edge. Jags this off the corridor, Bishoo jabs and misses
length at middle stump, defended back towards the bowler
full ball swinging in from wide outside off. Left alone
length ball slanted in at the pads. Looks to flick, caught on the thigh guard
another indipper. Full and at the stumps. Bishoo with the annoying full face of the bat to keep it out
tossed up at leg stump, driven to mid-on
length at the stumps, defended on the front foot
length and into the pads, flicked to fine leg
length on middle, driven to long-on
back of a length at the stumps, punched to midwicket
length on the pads, front foot stab to midwicket

taken at gully! Bishoo the victim of his own ambition. Short and wide ball from Lakmal, who is back over the wicket. No crazy movement, no extra bounce. Just an expansive stroke for which he is not fully in position. Static as he looks for the cut and it's sliced for a good catch. Superb innings from Bishoo. Five fifty-plus stands he's been involved in, in his last 14 innings. But a half-century continues to evade him in first-class cricket.
beauty. Length ball bending away in the corridor. He looks to defend on the front foot but can't get close
short of a length outside off, lets it through
looks to bend one away from middle stump, it goes down leg side with the angle

this is very very close. Aleem Dar says not out. Height? Length ball slams him just above the knee roll, on first look. It's not a big forward stride. He's on front of leg stump. Sri Lanka review it. No edge on it...umpire's call on hitting! That was close. Clipping the top of leg, but Dar had to give that out for it to be out.
short of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
length at off, blocked on the front foot
arm ball skids into leg stump, whipped to long leg off the back foot
length on middle stump, defended on the front foot
length, off stump, soft-handed defence close to the body
drifted in outside off, slight grip off the surface. But comfortably blocked
length on middle stump, shapes away towards off and squares him up. But he manages to push it down the pitch
length ball outside off, defended from the crease

has he got him?! Big sound as Dowrich gets squared and one carries through to the keeper. Not out says Dar! Sri Lanka will review, for sure. Sensational ball, angled in and then shaping away late from the corridor. Turns out it's a sensational decision too. 'Well done, mate,' says third umpire Ian Gould. That has brushed the back thigh. Review lost.
another appeal, this time for lbw. But this is fairly obvious. Climbs from a length and strikes him in front of leg as he tries to flick. Way too high
length ball down leg side, looks to flick, misses
length ball outside off, defended on the front foot
length on leg stump, blocked on the front foot
tossed up at middle stump, dead-batted
flighted, no drift, no turn. Front foot block
short of a length, low skidder outside off. Looks to cut, beaten
length ball on leg stump, nudged down the pitch off the front foot
nicely bowled. Beats him in flight at a leg stump line as he pushes forward. Cops it on the front pad
length ball just outside off. Gets deep in the crease and drops this into the leg side with soft hands
good length ball swinging late outside off. Defended to gully off the outside half
length ball on leg stump, clipped to midwicket from the crease
length ball down leg side, can't get bat on the flick
short and very wide outside off. Left alone
short of a length ball down leg side, past the inside edge as he flicks
hello, spin! Where have you been? That is BIG turn. Herath doesn't do that a lot. Slow drifter in at off stump, pitches and rips past the outside edge
arm ball at off stump. Blocked late off the inside half
full on off, and defended off the front foot towards cover
full outside off, and that's been confidently driven down the ground to mid off. No chance of a single
length ball outside off, and the the batsman shoulders his arms on this occasion. Through to the keeper
length ball outside off once again. Dowrich just stands in his crease and sees the ball go past him
length ball outside off, and angling into the batsman. Clipped off his pads to the vacant midwicket region. Moves to 97
full, but wide outside off. The ball's swinging further away and Roach goes chasing after it. Misses the drive and the ball goes through to Dickwella
length ball outside off, and Roach sticks his bat out. Taps it to cover point
length ball at the stumps. Blocked very late, into the leg side
tossed up at off stump, pushed back to the bowler
tossed up at off stump, tapped back to the bowler
floated up at off stump, driven neatly but short extra dives to his left to keep him on 97
length ball at leg stump, flicked to square leg, who is also there to keep him on 97
tossed up at off stump, driven back to the bowler
he's waited to bring this out. Obviously. Full ball wide outside off. Leans in and caresses it through point
length ball into the pads, looks to flick .Cops it on the pad and it trickles into the leg side. Appeal turned down, that's going down leg. Usually is for Gamage
length ball wide outside off, left alone
full inswinger, dangerously close to off stump. Roach happy to leave it
length outside off, left alone
overpitched ball outside off, left alone
length ball outside off, pokes it into the off side with the turn
nice and slow outside off, defended on the front foot

uppish but short of Herath. This is a good pace. Very slow, loopy on leg stump. He doesn't get to the pitch as he looks to drive. Closes the face early and it's off the leading edge. Herath leaps to his right but can only parry to mid-on
length on the stumps, blocked from the crease
stabs uppishly but there's no silly point. Loop, again. Very slow and Dowrich nowhere near the pitch as he defends with hard hands. It climbs on him and lobs safely into the off side
full on leg stump, flicked to midwicket
length ball at off stump, blocked into the pitch
length ball outside off, left alone
length ball outside off, walks into the forward defence, gets it out to point
yorker at off stump, jammed out to mid-off
short ball rising sharply outside off, left alone
keeps low but it's so wide outside off, the only person it bothers is Dickwella
tossed up at off stump, driven back to the bowler
length ball on off stump, plonks the front leg across and defends off the inside half
length ball outside off, dabbed into the off side
length outside off, blocked
top edge! Lobs over the keeper and evades slip! Woeful shot from Dowrich. Pre-meditated sweep. He's not getting close to the pitch of Herath lately. Mathews gives chase on the leg side from slip

there it is! Leaps off the floor, punches the air, strips off his helmet and he'll soon be with his proud team-mates. On the stroke of tea, Dowrich stabs a length ball on leg stump through square leg to become West Indies' first wicketkeeper centurion against Sri Lanka. This is also the slowest hundred by a West Indies wicketkeeper, but if you know context, you know that's not a worry at all. A top class innings, his second ton in Tests.
full, and wide outside off. Driven crisply past the cover-point region to the man in the deep
wide outside off, and seaming away from Roach. Tries to drive but misses completely. The WI batsmen look aggressive
full outside off, and shaping just a bit away from Roach. He tries to push at it, but misses once more
beaut! Length ball just outside off, and holding its line after pitching. Roach tried to defend thinking the ball will come in, but it never did. Just past the outside edge
full on off, and this time Roach makes contact. Comes forward and defends towards mid off
length ball on off, and Roach sees the over off by blocking it firmly
length ball just outside off, and spinning away. Left alone.
full just outside off again, and turning away from Dowrich. Fended towards cover
flighted on middle, and that's been tapped to short mid on on this occasion. Soft hands
tossed up outside off, and Dowrich leans into the drive. Straight to the bowler
width and flight offered, and this time Dowrich frees his arms. Comes down the wicket and smacks this over the non-striker's head. That's Dowrich's highest Test score
more flight, but lands outside off. Defended back to Herath
length ball on off, and straightens after pitching. He gets inside the line of the ball and fends it off the back foot
terrific ball! Entices Roach to play at it, but he can't get bat to ball. Length ball outside off, and seaming away after pitching. Through to Dickwella this time
back of a length outside off, and once again whizzing past the bat's outside edge. Roach looked to defend off the back foot, but his bat was nowhere near the delivery
length ball on middle, and that's been worked off his chest to the square-leg region
full on leg stump, and Roach fails to push it towards midwicket. Hits his front leg, but the ball would've gone down leg. Impact was outside leg as well
full outside off, and Roach walks down the wicket before pushing it to cover. Intercepted by the infielder
full outside off, and spinning away from him. Driven down the ground to long off for a walking single
full on off again, and Roach comes forward to block it back to the bowler
full just on off, but coming into Roach. Hits his front leg. Appeal for lbw, but rather soft. It would've gone down leg
flighted on middle, and Roach takes a big stride forward. Tapped to the on side
slower through the air this time. Full outside off, and fended with soft hands. Has to be careful with three infielders lurking
full outside off, and driven expansively. Finds the man at cover though
length ball on off, and Dowrich shuffles across to the off side. BLocked off the back foot
length ball outside off, but angling into Dowrich. Defended off the back foot
full outside off, but the ball seams away from Dowrich. He's happy to shoulder his arms this time
back of a length on off, and gets big on Dowrich. Punches it to mid on, but rather uncomfortably
full on middle, and angling into his body. Works it off his pads to the sweeper fielder on the leg side
full just outside off, and that's been driven confidently off the front foot. Can't beat cover though
full just outside off, and pushed to the off side with soft hands
worked off his pads to the leg side this time. Holder at fine leg cleans up
full outside off, and this time he opens his bat's face to defend behind square on the off side. Safe batting
muscled! Over Herath this time. Offers some flight outside off, and this time Roach is done playing. Not off the bat's sweet spot, but still enough behind it to clear the infield and more
full on middle, and defended towards the on side

chance of a catch, and then a chance of a run out! But neither materialise. Length ball outside off, and the batsman slices it to cover point. Roshen Silva pounces on it, turns and has a shy at the non-striker's. Misses though. Dowrich would've been gone....
full just outside off, and Roach walks across to the off side before pushing towards cover
full outside off, but the ball stays low! Roach goes for a wild swing but misses the shot altogether
length ball outside off. Roach opens his bat's face, and flays it towards backward point

hits his helmet! But the ball goes over the slip cordon for four. Roach looks fine, I think. Short on off, and Roach tried to duck under it. But the ball didn't bounce as much, and hits the back of his helmet. Glad to see he's okay
length ball on off, and Dowrich goes onto the back foot. Taps it towards the leg side
full just outside off. Defended off the front foot to the off side
full just outside off. Stays on the back foot and pushes it towards mid on
